questions.text: A 42-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to nausea, vomiting, and blurred vision. He was making his own whiskey with a home moonshine still and started feeling sick after sampling the first several ounces of distillate. Funduscopic evaluation reveals optic disc hyperemia. Laboratory results show a high anion gap metabolic acidosis. He is started on fomepizole, a medication that transiently binds to alcohol dehydrogenase. Which of the following graphs most accurately portrays the change in enzyme kinetics after administration of the antidote?
questions.solution: Ans. A)

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy presents to the pediatric clinic with a palpable abdominal mass. An ultrasound of the abdomen reveals a mass with stippled calcifications and displacement of the kidney inferolaterally without distortion of the collecting system. The mass is non-mobile and appears to cross the midline. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Neuroblastoma

questions.text: A 21-year-old female college student with a history of anxiety is brought to the physician for evaluation of fatigue for the past 6 months. Over the past year, she has had extreme fluctuations in her weight and has become more distant from her friends. She admits to binge eating and induced vomiting. Examination shows poor dentition. This patient is most likely to have which of the follow in serum laboratory profiles?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) pH-7.49, HCO3- 34, Anion gap-9, K-3.0

 

This patient has bulimia nervosa (binge eating with self-induced vomiting, poor dentition due to gastric acid exposure). Repeated vomiting leads to loss of gastric acid (hydrogen and chloride ions) which results in metabolic alkalosis. The kidney compensates by retaining bicarbonate, so HCO3 is elevated. Vomiting also causes loss of potassium in two ways: direct gastric K loss and renal K wasting due to secondary hyperaldosteronism. Therefore, labs show an alkalemic pH, high bicarbonate, normal anion gap, and hypokalemia.

Which of the following circuits is most appropriate for spontaneous ventilation in pediatric patients due to its low resistance and dead space?

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her neighbors 30 minutes after they found her unconscious. Her neighbors report that she has been spending more time at home by herself because she recently lost her job. On arrival, she is unable to provide a history. Her pulse is 76/min, respirations are 13/min, and blood pressure is 114/72 mm Hg. Examination shows significant weakness of the left upper and lower extremities. She is unable to plantar flex the ankle while supine. She is able to stand on her toes. Her gait is unsteady. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ and symmetric. An MRI of the brain and MR angiography show no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

questions.text: A 65-year-old man presents with hematuria and left flank pain. Imaging studies reveal a renal mass, and a subsequent biopsy confirms the diagnosis of papillary renal cell carcinoma. Which of the following cytogenetic abnormalities is most characteristic of papillary chromophilic renal cell carcinoma?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Trisomy 7/17

 

  • Papillary RCC (chromophilic type) is most commonly associated with trisomy of chromosomes 7 and 17 and loss of Y in males.
  • This contrasts with clear cell RCC, which is commonly linked to loss of 3p and VHL gene mutations.
  • Xp translocations are characteristic of MiT family translocation RCC, seen mainly in children and young adults.
  • Cytogenetic profiling helps in diagnosis, prognosis, and targeted therapy planning.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Loss of 3p: Incorrect. typical of clear cell RCC, seen in VHL syndrome.

 

Option C. Xp translocation: Incorrect. seen in translocation-associated RCC, mostly in pediatric patients.

 

Option D. Mutant VHL gene: Incorrect. hallmark of clear cell RCC, leading to HIF pathway activation.

questions.solution: Ans. C) Flow cytometry

questions.text: Composition of lactulose:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Galactose + Fructose

questions.text: A researcher is conducting a study to identify gene mutations associated with a rare genetic disorder. The researcher decides to use DNA microarrays for this purpose. Which of the following techniques allows DNA microarrays to detect gene mutations?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Hybridization

choices.text: Retrospective cohort study

questions.text: A group of investigators is studying the association between a fire retardant chemical used on furniture and interstitial lung disease. They use hospital records to identify 50 people who have been diagnosed with interstitial lung disease. They also identify a group of 50 people without interstitial lung disease who are matched in age and geographic location to those with the disease. The participants' exposure to the chemical is assessed by surveys and home visits. Which of the following best describes this study design?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Case-control study

questions.text:
Identify the true statements:

 

  1. Aminophylline acts as an adenosine receptor antagonist leading to diuresis
  2. Filgrastim is the drug of choice for chemotherapy induced thrombocytopenia
  3. Cephalosporins that do not require dose adjustment in renal failure because they are secreted in bile are ceftriaxone and cefoperazone.
  4. Denosumab can decrease bone resorption as well as increase bone formation
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1, 3

questions.text:
A 16-year-old girl is brought to the physician because she has not attained menarche. She is 165 cm (5 ft 5 in) tall and weighs 60 kg ; BMI is 22 kg/m2. Breast development is Tanner stage 4, and pubic hair development is Tanner stage 1.

 

Pelvic examination shows a blind vaginal pouch. This patient is most likely to have which of the following karyotypes?
questions.solution: Ans. D) 46XY

questions.text: A 25-year-old male with epilepsy presents with gingival overgrowth as shown in the image. Which antiepileptic drug is most likely to lead to this adverse effect?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Phenytoin

questions.text: A respiratory physiology seminar presents a pressure-volume loop obtained from a patient during mechanical ventilation. The difference in the course of the inspiratory loop and the expiratory loop in the curve is being discussed. The difference in the course of the inspiratory loop and the expiratory loop in the curve is due to which of the following conditions:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Difference in Surfactant Concentration

choices.text: Footplate of Stapes

questions.text: Otosclerosis most commonly begins at which of the following locations?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Fossula Ante-fenestrum

questions.text: A forensic expert is investigating a sexual assault case and needs to determine the timeline of the incident using Lugol's iodine test. What is the maximum duration after an assault that this test can yield positive results?
questions.solution: Ans. C) 4 days

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presents with progressive weakness in his legs, spasticity, and difficulty walking. Which toxin is most likely responsible for his symptoms?
questions.solution: Ans. A) BOAA

questions.text: What is the most common cause of neonatal mortality in India?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Prematurity

questions.text: A 5-day post-operative patient on intravenous fluids presents with angular stomatitis and following appearance of cornea. Which of the following TCA cycle enzymes is most likely affected in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Succinate dehydrogenase

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman comes to the physician with a 6-month history of breast tenderness and menstrual irregularities. An ultrasound of the pelvis shows a right adnexal mass. A laparoscopic right salpingo-oophorectomy is performed. Histologic examination of the adnexal mass shows small cuboidal cells arranged in clusters surrounding a central cavity with eosinophilic secretions. These cells resemble primordial follicles. Which of the following laboratory values was most likely increased in this patient at the time of presentation?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Estradiol

questions.text: A 32-year-old man is being evaluated due to several weeks of watery diarrhea. He has also had intermittent, crampy abdominal pain and has lost 7 kg during this period. The patient has a history of HIV and was hospitalized 6 months ago for Pneumocystis pneumonia. Stool tests for leukocytes and occult blood are negative. Endoscopy is performed, and mucosal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Cryptosporidium parvum

questions.text: The marked structure secretes which hormone?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Adrenaline

choices.text: Myringotomy with tympanostomy tube insertion

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to a hospital with a 3-week history of muffled hearing and a sensation of fullness in the right ear. Examination is shown below.  The patient denies any recent upper respiratory infections or allergies. In managing his condition, which procedure is most appropriate to relieve his symptoms?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Myringotomy with tympanostomy tube insertion

questions.text: A 62-year-old postmenopausal woman with a history of hormone receptor (HR)-positive metastatic breast cancer presents to the oncology clinic for follow-up. Her oncologist decides to initiate a treatment that works as an estrogen receptor antagonist by promoting receptor downregulation. Which of the following medications is most appropriate for this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Fulvestrant

questions.text: Which of the following regions remains constant during muscle contraction?
questions.solution: Ans. B) B

choices.text: Myosin heavy chain defect

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 1-year history of progressive shortness of breath. She is now unable to jog for more than 10 minutes without stopping to catch her breath. Cardiac examination shows a harsh systolic, crescendo-decrescendo murmur best heard at the lower left sternal border. The murmur increases in intensity when she moves from a squatting to a standing position and decreases when she clenches her fists. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her condition?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Myosin heavy chain defect

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman presents with progressive dyspnea and fatigue over 2 years. Physical exam reveals pedal edema, jugular venous distention, and hepatomegaly, with clear lung fields. Chest CT shows right heart enlargement. Cardiac catheterization reveals increased pulmonary arterial pressure without valve gradients or shunts. A transbronchial biopsy shows plexiform lesions with smooth muscle hypertrophy and luminal narrowing. Which of the following genetic mutations is most likely responsible?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Bone morphogenetic receptor 2 (BMPR2)

choices.text: Maternal surface presents at vulva
Most common method of separation

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman is in the third stage of labor, and the placenta is about to be delivered. Which statement is incorrect regarding Duncan's placental separation?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Most common method of separation

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes and breast cancer treated with tamoxifen presents with acute chest pain and syncope. She has no palpable pulses and the ECG strip is shown. CPR is initiated. What is the most appropriate next step?
questions.solution: Ans. A) IV epinephrine therapy

choices.text: Every 10th patient has a Y-linked disorder
1/3rd of Mendelian disorders is autosomal recessive
Every 5th patient has an X-linked recessive disorder
2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding Mendelian mode of inheritance?
questions.solution: Ans. D) 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

choices.text: Thickening of cervical mucus
Inhibition of rise in luteinizing hormone
Suppression of ovarian folliculogenesis
Increase of sex-hormone binding globulin

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman comes to the physician to discuss the prescription of an oral contraceptive. She has no history of major medical illness and takes no medications. She does not smoke cigarettes. She is prescribed combined levonorgestrel and ethinylestradiol tablets. Which of the following is the most important mechanism of action of this drug in the prevention of pregnancy?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Inhibition of rise in luteinizing hormone

choices.text: Drug A in the graph is epinephrine
The effect on heart rate in graph A can be prevented by anti-muscarinic agents
Drug acting on graph B is isoprenaline
Drug acting in the graph C is nor-epinephrine

questions.text: A pharmacology resident is studying the cardiovascular effects of three different adrenergic drugs, labelled A, B, and C. They recorded blood pressure and heart rate responses to these drugs and plotted the results as shown in the graphs below. Based on the graphs, which of the following statements is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. B) The effect on heart rate in graph A can be prevented by anti-muscarinic agents

questions.text: Thirty minutes after normal vaginal delivery of twins, a 35-year-old woman, gravida 5, para 4, has heavy vaginal bleeding with clots. Physical examination shows a soft, enlarged, and boggy uterus. Despite bimanual uterine massage, administration of uterotonic drugs, and placement of an intrauterine balloon for tamponade, the bleeding continues. A hysterectomy is performed. Vessels running through which of the following structures must be ligated during the surgery to achieve hemostasis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Cardinal ligament

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman has inherited a mutant BRCA1 gene and has a 60% chance of developing breast cancer by the age of 50. The BRCA1 gene produces a protein involved in the repair of DNA double-strand breaks. Which of the following processes is adversely affected by the deficiency of the BRCA1 protein?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Homologous recombination

choices.text: Anterior cardiac vein
Great cardiac vein
Middle cardiac vein
Small cardiac vein

questions.text: Identify the marked structure
questions.solution: Ans. B) Great cardiac vein

choices.text: Left coronary artery
Proximal right coronary artery
Left anterior descending artery
Posterior interventricular artery

questions.text: A 69-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe epigastric pain and vomiting that started 30 minutes ago while gardening. His pulse is 55/min, respirations are 30/min, and blood pressure is 90/50 mm Hg. Crackles are heard in both lower lung fields. An ECG shows ST segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Coronary angiography is most likely to show narrowing of which of the following vessels?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Proximal right coronary artery

choices.text: CT angiography to look for large vessel occlusion
MRI to look for infarct Occlusion
Tab labetalol 10 mg stat

questions.text: A 50-year-old man suddenly developed right-sided weakness and aphasia within 2 hours. His BP recorded was 160/110 mmHg and NCCT was clear. What is the next step in management?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Thrombolysis

choices.text: Squamous cell carcinoma of the left main bronchus

questions.text: In a patient who died from ventilator associated pneumonia after prolonged ventilation due to an intracerebral hemorrhage caused by cerebral metastases from a squamous cell carcinoma of the left main bronchus. What should be recorded in the line I (c) of the death certificate?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Cerebral metastasis

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Casoni test – Malaria

choices.text: Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception
Absence of fine motor movement of fingers
Absence of contralateral lower limb proprioception

questions.text: A patient met with a road traffic accident and developed a cervical spine injury. The fracture fragment had pierced the medial aspect of the dorsal column tract. Which of the following findings is seen in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception

choices.text: Phase II
Phase III
Phase I

questions.text: A research group wants to assess the safety and toxicity profile of a new drug. A clinical trial is conducted with 20 volunteers to estimate the maximum tolerated dose and monitor the apparent toxicity of the drug. The study design is best described as which of the following phases of a clinical trial?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Phase I

questions.text: Which of the following reactions does not contribute to the production of NADPH for fatty acid synthesis?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Cytoplasmic malate dehydrogenase

questions.text: All of the following muscles have parallel oriented fibers except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Tibialis anterior

questions.text: A forensic expert is analyzing a gunshot wound found on a deceased individual during an autopsy. The wound shows extensive tissue damage around the entry point, suggesting a specific range of fire. Based on the wound characteristics presented in the image, what is the most likely distance between the victim and the firearm?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Near

choices.text: Diffuse thickening of the GBM with a spike and dome pattern
Tram-track appearance of the GBM

questions.text: 41-year-old man, who was recently found to have renal vein thrombosis, is under medical review. His medical history includes significant weight gain, generalized edema, and hypertension. His urine analysis reveals significant proteinuria and the presence of numerous normal-looking red blood cells without any casts. Tests also show positive anti-PLA2R antibodies. Based on these findings, what would you expect to see on his renal biopsy?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Diffuse thickening of the GBM with spike and dome pattern

questions.text: A 24-year-old swimmer presents with sudden onset of fever, headache, nausea, and neck stiffness. After a few days, the patient develops confusion and seizures. The microscopic slide of CSF is shown below. Based on the clinical presentation and microscopic findings, which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for these symptoms?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Naegleria

choices.text: A = pulmonary, B = aortic, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral
A = aortic, B = pulmonary, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral
A = tricuspid, B = aortic, C = pulmonary, D = Mitral
A = aortic, B = tricuspid, C = pulmonary, D = Mitral

questions.text: Correctly match the sites of cardiac valve auscultation from the given image.
questions.solution: Ans. B) A = aortic, B = pulmonary, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral

choices.text: Discontinue anti-leprosy medication and initiate steroids and antibiotics
Prescribe thalidomide and steroids
Continue anti-leprosy medication and add steroids

questions.text: A 30-year-old pregnant woman undergoing treatment for leprosy presents with symptoms of Erythema Nodosum Leprosum (ENL), a severe inflammatory reaction. What is the appropriate management strategy in this case?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Continue anti-leprosy medication and add steroids

choices.text: Between two heads of pronator teres
At the level of supinator muscle

questions.text: The nerve being tested here is injured most likely at what site?
questions.solution: Ans. D)  Medial epicondyle

questions.text: Which of the following drugs can act at both sites labelled as 1 and 2 in the diagram?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Sampatrilat

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman comes to the physician for an annual pelvic examination and Pap smear. Her last Pap smear was 3 years ago.  A photomicrograph of cervical cells from the Pap smear specimen is shown. Cells similar to the one indicated by the arrow are most likely to be seen in which of the following conditions?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Condylomata acuminata

choices.text: Anterior tibial artery
Posterior tibial artery
Dorsalis pedis artery

questions.text: Which artery is being palpated?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Posterior tibial artery

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of a 6-week history of increased tiredness, irritability, and worsening leg pain. Examination shows conjunctival pallor and diffuse petechiae. There are palpable, nontender posterior cervical and axillary lymph nodes. His hemoglobin concentration is 8.9 g/dL, leukocyte count is 45,750/mm , and platelet count is 25,000/mm'. A bone marrow aspiration shows numerous immature cells that stain positive for CD10, CD19, and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TT). Which of the following translocations is associated with a favorable prognosis for this patient's condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) t(12;21)

choices.text: No further treatment
Perform extended cholecystectomy

questions.text: A patient underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy for cholelithiasis. Histopathology of the resected gall bladder is reported as Stage T1a of gallbladder cancer. What would be the next line of management?
questions.solution: Ans. A) No further treatment.

questions.text:
Match the following light measurement units with their correct descriptions:

 

Column A

 

  1. Candela
  2. Lumen
  3. Lux
  4. Lambert

 

Column B

 

  1. Flow of light
  2. Amount of light reaching surface
  3. Amount of light re-emitted by surface
  4. Luminous intensity
questions.solution: Ans. A) 1-d, 2-a, 3-b, 4-c

choices.text: Prolonged QT interval

questions.text: A 55-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after collapsing at the grocery store and losing consciousness for 1 minute following a sudden onset of palpitations.  He has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and is currently being treated as an outpatient for pneumonia. His current medications include lisinopril, metformin, and azithromycin.  During the examination, he loses consciousness again. ECGshows polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with cyclic alteration of the QRS axis, which spontaneously resolves after 30 seconds. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's syncope?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Prolonged QT interval

choices.text: Only abductor is lateral cricoarytenoid
Recurrent laryngeal nerve supplies all intrinsic muscles of larynx
Sensory supply to the larynx is by superior laryngeal nerve only
False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.text: Which of the following is a true statement?
questions.solution: Ans. D) False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements

 

  1. Potassium levels in vitreous humor fall linearly after death and are a useful measure of time of death.
  2. Suspended animation can be seen after electrocution.
  3. The 'chicken fat' appearance is typical of a postmortem thrombus.
  4. TM, lung and colon are susceptible in secondary blast injury.
questions.solution: Ans. C) 2,3

choices.text: It uses cell-free circulating fetal DNA in the maternal serum.
It is used for the confirmation of trisomy 13, 18 and 21.
It can be performed after 10 weeks of gestation.
It is done after the routine first trimester ultrasound assessment.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect about non-invasive prenatal testing?
questions.solution: Ans. B) It is used for the confirmation of trisomy 13, 18 and 21.

questions.text: A 34-year-old man comes to the physician because of foul-smelling diarrhea, fatigue, and bloating for 6 months. He has type 1 diabetes mellitus that is well-controlled with insulin. Examination shows conjunctival pallor and inflammation of the corners of the mouth. The patient undergoes upper endoscopy. A photomicrograph of tissue from an intestinal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is most likely to improve this patient's symptoms?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Avoidance of certain grains

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl presents to the clinic with localized pain in her left knee that worsens at night. She has no significant past medical history and reports no recent trauma. Physical examination reveals mild swelling and tenderness over the proximal tibia. Laboratory studies show normal white blood cell count and inflammatory markers. An X-ray of the knee is performed, revealing a well-defined lytic lesion with sclerotic margins in the proximal tibial metaphysis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Brodie’s abscess

questions.text: As a medical officer at a district hospital, you are analyzing skeletal remains discovered during an excavation to determine the sex of the deceased. Which of the following indices is typically higher in the male pelvis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Chilotic line index

questions.text: A 30-year-old male sustains a degloving injury to his right lower leg in a motorcycle accident. Which triage color code is most appropriate for this injury?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Yellow

questions.text: Identify the correct ASA-PS grade:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Pregnant-II

choices.text: Increase in cAMP
Increase in cGMP
ADP-ribosylation of EF2
ADP-ribosylation of G protein

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium shown in the figure below?
questions.solution: Ans. C) ADP-ribosylation of EF2

questions.text: Identify the fracture shown in the given image:
questions.solution: Ans. A) Bennett’s fracture

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements:

 

  1. Social smile – 2months
  2. Walk without support -12months
  3. Babbling gibberish-15months
  4. Walk upstairs with alternate foot – 4yrs
  5. Copy a circle-2yrs
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,3

choices.text: Thrombus in the superior mesenteric artery
Transmural inflammation of the large bowel
Atherosclerotic narrowing of the mesenteric arteries
Tortuous submucosal blood vessels

questions.text:
A 79-year-old man with aortic stenosis comes to the emergency room because of

worsening fatigue for 5 months. During this time, he has also had intermittent bright red

blood mixed in with his stool. Physical examination shows pale conjunctivae and a crescendo-decrescendo systolic murmur best heard at the second right intercostal space. The abdomen is soft and non-tender. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin of 8 g/dL and a mean corpuscular volume of 71 um. Which of the following is the most likely

underlying mechanism of this patient's bleeding?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Tortuous submucosal blood vessels

choices.text: It can cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB)
Paramagnetic material which can shorten the T1 relaxation time
Long-term studies show gadolinium deposition in the basal ganglia at high doses

questions.text: During a radiology department seminar, a discussion focuses on the properties and safety of gadolinium-based contrast agents. Which of the following statements about gadolinium is false?
questions.solution: Ans. A) It can cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB)

questions.text: A 25-year-old male was brought to the emergency department after being struck on his head by the house door and temporarily fainting. On examination, his sensorium was intact. NCCT head was performed and study was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Concussion

questions.text:
Identify the wrong statements

 

1. HU for fat is 100

2. Iohexol may be used as an oral contrast in suspected oesophageal perforation

3. BMFT is useful for evaluation of colonic strictures

4. Dose of radiation is directly proportional to the square of the distance from the source
questions.solution: Ans. C) 1,3,4

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair
questions.solution: Ans. D) Ethionamide- Colour vision changes

questions.text: A patient was started on anticoagulant therapy for deep vein thrombosis (DVT). The next day, he presented with the features shown in the figure below. Which of the following drugs is most likely implicated in this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Warfarin

choices.text: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.text: A young male came to the hospital with a clean-cut wound without any bleeding. The patient received a full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management for this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Single-dose tetanus toxoid

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman with irritable bowel syndrome comes to the physician because of increased diarrhea. The increase in stool frequency began when she started a new job. She is started on loperamide, and her symptoms improve. Which of the following is the primary mechanism of action of this drug?
questions.solution: Ans. A) u-opioid receptor agonism

choices.text: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence
There will be a higher probability of a type I error
There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results
The study will have more statistical power

questions.text: A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

questions.text: A 45-year-old female presents with something coming out per anus. Which of the following is not the perineal approach for this disease?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Ripstein

questions.text: What is the fluid requirement in a 3 days old baby with birth weight of 1300 grams?
questions.solution: Ans. C) 120-130 ml /kg/day

choices.text: Sudden loss of muscle tone

questions.text: A 37-year-old woman visits the clinic, reporting excessive daytime sleepiness, vivid hallucinations when falling asleep and upon waking, and difficulty initiating sleep at night. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic symptom of narcolepsy?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Catalepsy

choices.text: Insert iv cannula and start iv fluids

questions.text: A 25-year-old male patient presented with sudden onset breathlessness and a sharp pain in his chest after a road traffic accident. His BP is 85/69mm Hg and HR is 110bpm. The chest X-ray is given below. What is the next step for this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Needle thoracostomy

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient with a long history of severe eosinophilic asthma presents to the clinic. Despite being treated with high-dose inhaled corticosteroids and long-acting beta-agonists, she continues to have frequent asthma exacerbations requiring systemic corticosteroids. After further evaluation, the physician decides to initiate a monoclonal antibody therapy that targets IL-5R. Which of the following medications targets IL-5R and works by antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC)?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Benralizumab

questions.text: You are a medical resident working in a busy hospital when a 25-year-old female patient is admitted with complaints of chronic fatigue, easy bruising, and hepatosplenomegaly. A bone marrow examination reveals cells with a characteristic appearance as shown in an image. In this clinical scenario, which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for her condition?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Beta-Gluco-cerebrosidase

questions.text: 20 accidental pregnancies happen after 100 women used a new contraceptive device for 2yrs. What is the pearl index?
questions.solution: Ans. D) 10

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents to the clinic with persistent joint pain and swelling in her hands and knees. Laboratory tests reveal elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and C-reactive protein (CRP). Further testing shows elevated levels of multiple cytokines. Which of the following cytokines is least likely to be involved in promoting inflammation in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. D) IL-10

questions.text: A 45-year-old man is brought to the clinic by his wife, who reports a year-long history of the patient's declining memory and cognitive abilities. The patient was previously diagnosed with a type of cortical dementia. Which of the following is NOT classified as a cortical dementia?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Lewy body dementia.

questions.text: A patient has hyperkalemia, raised uric acid levels and is going through hemodialysis. While this, patient develops drowsiness, had a seizure and got hypotensive. What can be given in treatment for this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Mannitol

choices.text: Curved, flagellated gram-negative rods
Gram-negative S-shaped rods with polar flagella
Irregularly drumstick-shaped gram-positive rods
Gram-positive lancet-shaped diplococci

questions.text: A 46-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital because of tarry-black stools and epigastric pain for 2 weeks. The epigastric pain is relieved after meals, but worsens after 1-2 hours. Fecal occult blood test is positive. Esophagogastroduodenoscopy shows a bleeding duodenal ulcer. Microscopic examination of a duodenal biopsy specimen is most likely to show which of the following?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Curved, flagellated gram-negative rods

questions.text: The most common organism causing osteomyelitis in drug abusers is:
questions.solution: Ans. B) Pseudomonas

choices.text: Located on the long arm of chromosome 13

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with a family history of breast cancer is found to have a BRCA1 mutation. Which of the following characteristics is associated with a BRCA1 mutation compared to a BRCA2 mutation?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Associated with medullary carcinoma

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman has been a cigarette smoker since the age of 18, averaging a pack a day of unfiltered cigarettes. She works as a dispatcher for a trucking company. She has had several episodes of hemoptysis in the past two weeks along with fatigue, headache, nausea, and anorexia. On physical examination, her sensorium is clouded. A chest radiograph shows an ill-defined hilar mass. A transbronchial lung biopsy is performed and the microscopic appearance is shown here. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this woman?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Hyponatremia

questions.text: Calculate the mid parental height of a male patient with father height 183 cm and mother height 175cm?
questions.solution: Ans. A) 185.5

questions.text: Which intracellular molecule is primarily responsible for mediating the effects of ANP?
questions.solution: Ans. C) cGMP

questions.text: The diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide is decreased in patients with:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Emphysema

choices.text: Metabolic acidosis with respiratory compensation
Metabolic alkalosis and metabolic acidosis
Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

questions.text: A 9 -year-old boy presents to the emergency department because of 18 hours of severe vomiting. Arterial blood gas analysis reveals a pH of 7.48, a bicarbonate level of 35 mEq/L, and a partial carbon dioxide pressure of 48 mm Hg. Which of the following best describes the acid-base disturbance occurring in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

choices.text: Cells are p63 and p40 positive
Pathology is peripheral in location

questions.text: A 70-year-old male with a long history of smoking presents to the clinic with a chronic non-productive cough that has persisted for 6 months. He also reports weight loss, anorexia, and intermittent chest pain. A chest CT scan reveals a mass lesion, and a biopsy is performed (image provided). Which of the following statements best describes the pathology seen in this patient's biopsy?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Cells are p63 and p40 positive

questions.text: 28-year women with chronic pelvic pain and infertility of 3 years. A transvaginal ultrasound reveals the following. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Chocolate cyst

choices.text: Codex Alimentarius is the principal organ of the FAO/WHO food standards program
Vanaspati is fortified with 2500 IU of vitamin A and 175 IU of vitamin D
Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation
Sudden onset of hypersecretory glaucoma, diarrhea, and cardiac failure is seen due to sanguinarine toxicity

questions.text: All of the following are true except:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

questions.text: A 2-day old infant presents with bilious vomiting and abdominal distension. AXR is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Jejunal atresia

choices.text: Res ipsa loquitor

questions.text: Dr. Kavita, a recent medical school graduate, is attending a workshop on medical law. The presenter discusses a case where a patient alleged civil negligence against a physician, but the lawsuit was not filed within the legally designated period. Dr. Kavita is asked to identify the legal doctrine that bars the case from being opened after this period. Which term correctly identifies this doctrine?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Res indicata

questions.text: A 31-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of abdominal pain and diarrhea. He reports that his stools are streaked with blood and mucus. He returned from a vacation in Kerala 3 weeks ago. His vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal examination shows hyperactive bowel sounds. A photomicrograph of a trichrome-stained wet mount of a stool specimen is shown. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Entameoba

questions.text: Which drug is used in conjunction with phentermine for the management of obesity?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Topiramate

choices.text: Level of uterus on day 2- 2 finger breadth below umbilicus
Warburg effect-Aerobic glycolysis
Braille- Merkel cell receptors
MCC of acute epiglottitis-S.bovis

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution: Ans. D) MCC of acute epiglottitis-S.bovis

choices.text: It overcomes limitations in the quality of individual studies.
It is able to provide evidence of causality.
The results are less precise.
The likelihood of type II errors is decreased.

questions.text: A group of environmental health scientists recently performed a nationwide cross-sectional study that investigated the risk of head and neck cancers in patients with a history of cigar smoking. In collaboration with three teams of epidemiologists that have each conducted similar cross-sectional studies in their respective countries, they have agreed to contribute their data to an international pooled analysis of the relationship between non- cigarette tobacco consumption and prevalence of head and neck cancers. Which of the following statements regarding the pooled analysis in comparison to the individual studies is true?
questions.solution: Ans. D) The likelihood of type II errors is decreased.

questions.text: A 56-year-old man, who recently recovered from a viral infection, visits his primary care physician for a follow-up. The physician orders a blood test to assess the patient's immune status, specifically focusing on identifying memory T cells, which are crucial for long-term immunity. Which of the following markers will the lab use to identify the memory T cells in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. B) CD45RO

questions.text: The defined population norm for Urban-Primary health centre in our country is?
questions.solution: Ans. B) 1 per 50,000

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is most likely transmitted by this vector?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Visceral leishmaniasis

choices.text: A-1, B-2, C-3, D-4, E-5
A-4, B-1, C-2, D-5, E-3
A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5
A-3, B-2, C-4, D-5, E-1

questions.text: Match the following steps of ventricular action potential in the correct order:
questions.solution: Ans. C) A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5

questions.text: Sludder’s neuralgia is due to compression of anterior ethmoidal nerve by septal spur in the region of:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Middle turbinate

questions.text:
A 48-year-old man comes to the emergency department because of sudden right flank pain that began 3 hours ago. He also noticed blood in his urine. Over the past two weeks, he has developed progressive lower extremity swelling and a 4-kg  weight gain. Examination shows bilateral 2+ pitting edema of the lower extremities. Urinalysis with dipstick shows 4+ protein, positive glucose, and multiple red cell and fatty casts. Abdominal CT shows a large right kidney with abundant collateral vessels and a filling defect in the right renal vein. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms?

 

Hemoglobin : 8 g/dL

Platelet count :195,000/mm?

Prothrombin time :12 sec

Partial thromboplastin time: 49 sec
questions.solution: Ans. C)  Loss of antithrombin III

choices.text: Loculated pleural fluid
Pleural fluid pH < 7 .2
Pleural fluid glucose < 60 mg/dL
Pleural fluid LDH > 1000

questions.text: Indications of chest drain in a parapneumonic effusion are all except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Pleural fluid LDH > 1000

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of intense eye redness, watery discharge, and following appearance. Which of the following viruses is the most likely causative agent?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Enterovirus 70

choices.text: Vital capacity and Functional residual volume
Inspiratory capacity and Functional residual capacity
Vital capacity and Expiratory reserve volume
Inspiratory capacity and Residual volume

questions.text: In the presented spirometry image, what term corresponds to the point labeled as ‘D’ and ‘G’ respectively?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Inspiratory capacity and Functional residual capacity

questions.text: A public health researcher is studying the demographic transition model in India to understand population dynamics over time. The researcher is particularly interested in the contraction of the demographic gap, which is the difference between birth and death rates. At what stage of the demographic transition does the contraction of the demographic gap typically start?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Early Stage III

choices.text: Oral Nicardipine capsules
IV Labetalol

questions.text: A 52-year-old male presents with headache, confusion, visual disturbances, nausea, vomiting and seizures. On examination blood pressure is 220/110 mm Hg. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate for managing his condition?
questions.solution: Ans. D) IV Labetalol

questions.text: What does the x-axis of ROC curve represent?
questions.solution: Ans. B) False positive

choices.text: Tc99 sestamibi scan

questions.text: What is the IOC for PTH adenoma?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Tc99 sestamibi scan

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of shortness of breath and palpitations. On physical examination, you perform this test and you also hear a diastolic murmur over the left sternal border. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Aortic regurgitation
